intro: Euphrasia minima var. flava, commonly known as the yellow tansy, is a small flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been historically used in traditional herbal remedies.
